collections.description: users: accounts of people who create, comment, and manage blogs
blogs: individual blog sites owned by users
posts: blog posts authored by users within a blog
post_revisions: immutable versions of a post content for audit
post_tags: junction table between posts and tags
comments: user comments on posts with threaded replies
media_assets: files uploaded and attached across a blog
follows: user follows a blog to receive updates

properties.name: Address
Street
properties.description: Specifies the street name and number, providing detailed location information within a city or town.

properties.name: Postal code
properties.description: A numerical or alphanumeric code assigned to a geographic area to facilitate mail delivery and location identification.

properties.name: City
properties.description: Indicates the name of the city or town where the address is located, helping to define the broader geographic region.
Represents a physical location, including street details, postal code, and city information. Used to store and manage location-based data for individuals, businesses, or properties.
users: accounts of people who create, comment, and manage blogs
blogs: individual blog sites owned by users
posts: blog posts authored by users within a blog
post_revisions: immutable versions of a post content for audit
post_tags: junction table between posts and tags
comments: user comments on posts with threaded replies
media_assets: files uploaded and attached across a blog
follows: user follows a blog to receive updates

properties.name: Disclaimer
properties.value:
*About this model*

This model was created using a public GenAI tool (e.g., ChatGPT) prompted to generate an ER diagram in Mermaid syntax.
The Mermaid code was then imported into Hackolade Studio (v8.3.2+) via the reverse-engineering feature, either from a .mmd file or directly from the clipboard.

This approach allows rapid generation and editing of data models using Mermaids human-readable syntax as a bridge between GenAI and Hackolade Studio. While Mermaid lacks support for advanced constraints or physical schemas, it offers a fast, intuitive way to translate conceptual prompts into structured diagrams.

To learn more about importing Mermaid ER diagrams into Hackolade Studio: https://hackolade.com/help/GenAI-createdMermaidERdiagram.html
